src:
Satpol PP ke Pemilik 'Ngocok Yuk': Ranah Minang Punya Adat-Budaya
01 Nov 2019, 23:05 by Jeka Kampai
Padang - Kepala Satpol PP Kota Padang, Al Amin menyatakan akan menindak semua bentuk merek dagang yang berasosiasi negatif. Amin mengatakan pihaknya tak segan untuk menertibkan produk dagang yang bisa menimbulkan kegaduhan.
"Kita tidak main-main. Apapun itu, kalau mengundang kegaduhan dan memicu terjadinya persoalan-persoalan baru akan kita tertibkan," kata Al Amin kepada Detikcom, Jumat (1/11/2019).
Amin juga merespons pernyataan pemilik usaha minuman 'Ngocok Yuk', Winda Varesa yang merasa keberatan dengan penertiban terhadap usaha mitranya. Dia menepis anggapan bahwa Pemerintah Kota Padang membunuh usaha kecil.
"Kita hidup di Ranah Minang, yang orangnya punya adat dan budaya. Ada yang jualan Ngocok. Ngocok itu menurut pemikiran kita bersama, konotasinya negatif dan kotor. Masturbasi atau onani. Masa iya harus begitu," katanya.
"Kita tidak melarang apa-apa, bahkan mendukung pelaku usaha. Tapi tolong ya, melakukan usaha sesuai dengan norma dan kaidah kita sebagai orang Minangkabau," kata dia.
Sebelumnya, pemilik usaha minuman 'Ngocok Yuk', Winda Varesa menyesalkan langkah petugas Satpol PP Kota Padang, Sumatera Barat yang mengamankan dagangan mereka. Petugas dinilai telah melakukan pembunuhan merek mereka yang sudah mulai dikenal.
"Saya tidak bisa bilang keliru atau gimana langkah yang dilakukan Satpol PP itu. Saya hanya, sebelum menangkap harusnya mediasi dulu. Diimbau, lalu ada penjelasan. Kecuali melawan, baru ditangkap. Lah, ini main grebek dan tangkap. Harusnya diimbau dan ada pemberitahuan, nggak ditangkap kayak penjahat," kata Winda kepada Detikcom, Jumat (1/11/2019).

(idn/idn)
text:
Satpol PP to 'Ngukul Yuk' Owners: Minang Domains Have Cultural Traditions
Nov 01 2019, 23:05 by Jeka Kampai
Padang - Head of the Padang City Satpol PP, Al Amin, said that he would act against all forms of trademarks that were negatively associated. Amin said that his party was not reluctant to bring order to trade products that could cause noise.
"We are not playing. Whatever it is, if we invite noise and trigger new problems, we will deal with them," Al Amin told Detikcom, Friday (11/01/2019).
Amin also responded to the statement of the owner of the 'Ngukul Yuk' beverage business, Winda Varesa, who objected to the curbing of the business partners. He dismissed the notion that the Padang City Government killed small businesses.
"We live in the Minang realm, where people have customs and culture. Some sell Ngocok. According to our common opinion, the connotation is negative and dirty. Masturbation or masturbation. The period should be like that," he said.
"We do not forbid anything, even support businesses. But please, do business according to our norms and rules as Minangkabau people," he said.
Previously, the owner of the 'Ngocok Yuk' beverage business, Winda Varesa, deplored the steps of the Satpol PP officers in Padang City, West Sumatra to secure their wares. Officers are considered to have committed the murder of their brand which has begun to be known.
"I can't say it's wrong or what the Satpol PP steps are. I just, before arresting, I should mediate first. Called for it, then there is an explanation. Except fighting, then being arrested. not arrested like a criminal, "Winda said to Detikcom, Friday (11/01/2019).

(idn / idn)
